metadata.title: Gesellschaft ffir Toxikologische Pathologie 10th Annual Symposium Summaries of Case Presentations Adenoma and adenocarcinoma of the nasal cavity in a Wistar rat

body_text.text: A case of an adenoma and an adenocarcinoma in the nasal cavity of a female Wistar rat (HsdCpb:WU) is described. In rats, naturally occurring adenomas and adenocarcinomas of the nasal cavity are extremely rare, but these neoplasms can be induced by a variety of chemicals.

The rat inhaled an aerosol containing a low concentration of gasoline engine exhaust for 114 weeks and was sacrificed in a moribund condition at an age of 122 weeks. By light microscopical examination tumours were detected at two different localizations of the nasal cavity. One tumour showed invasive growth into the submucosal layer and was occluding partly the lumen of the nasal cavity. It was classified as an adenocarcinoma. The growth pattern of this tumour was predominantly solid, but glandular structures could be seen in some areas. The cells had oval nuclei and a small rim of eosinophilic cytoplasm. Rosette-like structures were not detectable. In addition, in the anterior part of the nasal cavity, a benign exophytic adenoma was observed. The tumour cells formed glandular structures and mucus production was evident.

Histogenetically, adenomas and adenocarcinomas of the nasal cavity can derive from respiratory, submucosal glandular, or olfactory epithelial cells. The observed adenocarcinoma most probably derived from cells of the submucosal glands. Localisation and growth pattern favour this origin. The exophytic adenoma, however, developed more likely from the respiratory epithelium. This tumour showed secretory activity and was covered by nonciliated and ciliated cuboidal to columnar cells. The adenocarcinoma showed some areas which stained immunohistochemically positive for cytokeratin. Staining for S-l 00 and vimentin was negative in both tumours.

WU rats (5 animals per group). At terminal sacrifice (day 3 of experiment) a severe acute necrosis of the olfactory epithelium was detectable in all animals treated with D or Ml. The squamous and respiratory epithelium as well as the Bowman's glands showed only minor degenerative changes. In a second experiment with repeated dosing (7 days) and lower doses (D: 8 mg/kg, Ml: 6.4 mg/kg, the sacrifice was performed on day 8 of the experiment. A mild to moderate subacute degeneration of the olfactory epithelium was accompanied by a slight reactive inflammation in most (D: 3/5, Ml: 4/5) animals. Mucosal defects were overlaid with a simple, reparative non-keratinizing squamous epithelium of 2 to 3 cell layers in all animals. The squamous and respiratory epithelium was unchanged. The toxicokinetic behavior of radio-labelled drug showed high concentrations (D and M 1) and a long persistence in the nasal mucosa of the rat. BRITIEBO A firm, greyish-white tumour projecting from the gingiva of the left posterior mandible and surrounding two molar teeth was observed in the oral cavity of a 22-month-old female Wistar control rat (strain: HsdCpb: WU) from a chronic inhalation toxicity/carcinogenicity study. The animal was killed due to progressive weight loss resulting from impairment of mastication.

Histologically, the tumour was covered by a hyperplastic gingival epithelium which in some areas showed marked keratinization. Branching cords of epithelium extended from the surface into the subjacent fibrous tumour tissue. This was fibroma-like and consisted of dense interwoven collagen bundles and numerous fibroblasts with large vesicular, round to spindle-shaped nuclei and prominent nucleoli. An admixture of predominantly mononuclear inflammatory cells was prominent in the superficial regions of the growth. Other tumour areas showed a more loosely arranged myxomatous stroma and degenerative changes such as cellular hydropic vacuolation and nuclear pyknosis. Small haemorrhages and foci of necrosis were present in areas of superficial ulceration with loss of the covering epithelium. A minor basal portion of the tumour, however, consisted of fibrosarcomatous tissue characterized by less collagen, increased cellularity, high mitotic rate, cellular and nuclear pleomorphism and local infiltration and destruction of the alveolar bone and molar teeth.

The clinical term 'epulis' indicates a growth 'on the gum' and includes true neoplasms as well as tumour-like lesions of connective tissue. With respect to the etiology and pathogenesis of epulides, they are often related to chronic mechanical irritation or to chronic gingival inflammation with development of excessive amounts of granulation tissue and sometimes fibrous neoplasms. Spontaneous epulides are very rare in laboratory rodents, but they may be induced by prolonged administration of calcium channel blockers. The development of tracheal cartilage degeneration and inflammation of the sero-mucinous glands of the oropharynx may be a factor causing early mortalities in long term studies with Fischer-344 (F-344) rats. The presence of these lesions was investigated in groups of male and female F-344 rats killed at 6, 19 and 32 weeks of age. Half of the rats killed at 19 and 32 weeks of age were sham treated with water (pH 10) by daily oral gavage for a duration of 13 or 26 weeks prior to autopsy in order to detect any influence on the laryngo-tracheal cavity due to dosing technique. A clear age-associated increase in severity and incidence of chondroid degeneration of the tracheal and laryngeal cartilage was revealed, with an onset as early as 6 weeks of age. After 19 weeks, a high frequency of oropharyngeal granuloma formation was found. No relationship of the lesions to the gavage technique was apparent. The F-344 rat strain may possess a predisposition for inflammatory and degenerative changes in the oropharyngeal and laryngo-tracheal cavity, changes which can lead to increased and unexpected mortality rates in nonclinical safety studies (1).

(1) GERMANN, P-G, and OCKERT, D (1994). Granulomatous inflammation of the oropharyngeal cavity as a possible cause for unexpected high mortality in a Fischer 344 rat carcinogenicity study. Lab Anim Sci 44 (4): 338-343.

Cystic keratinizing squamous cell carcinomas in the lung of Syrian hamsters induced by coal oven flue exhaust mixed with pyrolized tar pitch in combination with benzo(a)pyrene Induced pulmonary squamous cell carcinomas with pronounced formation of keratin lamellae in male Syrian hamsters (strain Cpb-ShGa51, TNO, Zeist, The Netherlands) are described. Male and female Syrian hamsters inhaled an aerosol containing a mixture of pyrolized tar pitch and coal oven flue exhaust (PCE) for up to 22 months. In addition, several hamsters were treated intratracheally with 0.1 ml benzo(a)pyrene (30 x 100 Ilg B(a)p/animal or 30 x 300 Ilg B(a)P/animal).

Ten Syrian hamsters (10 of 48) of the group which received PCE and 30 x 100 Ilg B(a)P developed squamous cell tumours. Most of these tumours contained large central masses of keratin and were classified microscopically as cystic keratinizing squamous cell carcinomas. Two of the neoplasms showed only limited features of malignancy. Their histological structure was characterized by a large mass of lamellated keratin which contained a small amount of cellular debris and was surrounded by a thin rim of stratified squamous epithelium. They were sharply demarcated from the surrounding pulmonary parenchyma and had some projections into the central keratin mass of epithelial cells. In significant portions of the wall, the cells had variations in size, shape, orientation, nuclear/cytoplasmic ratio and increased mitotic figures which were restricted to the basal layers. In the tumours with more pronounced malignant features, the central keratin was enveloped by epithelial cells that frequently revealed papillary or solid projections into the keratin. The tumours were not well demarcated. Focally, stratification of the epithelium was lost and the cells were irregularly arranged. Pleomorphism of the cells was marked and mitotic figures were frequent. A high incidence of granulomatous pneumonia was observed in 5 of 6 sources of rats. Only the BN-rats from Harlan, UK showed no granulomatous pneumonia. Great interindividual differences in the severity of pneumonia were noted in rats of the other breeders. A close relationship between granulomatous pneumonia and influx of eosinophilic granulocytes as a possible predisposition for an allergic response was evident in all animals effected. The great variability of the severity grade of pneumonia in all analysed rat sources, with the exception of rats from Harlan UK, questions the reproducibility of experiments of different laboratories with this animal model. In two parts the presentation gives an overview on the mutual supplement of clinical and histopathological methods for eye examination during experimental toxicity studies as well as examples from histopathological examination of eyes from Draize tests with severe irritation and/or corrosion.
"The best solution would be to give the pathologist an opportunity to perform an ophthalmoscopical examination of the eye in the living animal" SAUNDERS, JUBB (1962) .

For eye examination during toxicological studies both ophthalmological and histopathological methods are required. Only by combining the results a significant evaluation of the eye as a possible target organ of toxicity is feasible. Like no other organ, the eye provides even clinically an insight into the fine structure of the living organism. Ophthalmological findings are, therefore, the primary basis for diagnosis. In cases of pathological changes of refractive media they are often the only one. The clinical results must lead the pathologist to the possible alteration, lead him to choose the most appropriate histopathological method, and give the opportunity to include additional methods like biochemical investigations. A close cooperation between ophthalmologist and pathologist is essential for the scientifically correct evaluation of eyes from toxicity studies.

According to OECD guideline 405 eye corrosion is the production of irreversible tissue damage in the eye following application of a test substance to the anterior surface of the eye. The guideline does not include histopathological examination. According to this, irreversibility can only be evaluated by observations over a long period.

However, using histopathology for additional eye examination, clear diagnosis can be done serving as a reliable basis for evaluation of the reversibility of changes. Animals suffering from distress and severe pain can be sacrificed without awaiting a long observation period. An unusually high incidence of chronic suppurative inflammation of the anterior eye structures was observed in SPF Wistar rats (strain: HsdCpb:WU) which were exposed for up to 24 months to different concentrations of gasoline engine exhaust in a chronic inhalation toxicity/carcinogenicity study. The grossly detectable lesions ranged from uni-or bilateral moderate conjunctivitis to severe ulcerative keratoconjunctivitis and were combined with an increased tear flow.

Histopathological examination showed oedema and severe mixed inflammatory cell infiltration of the upper and lower eyelids, conjunctiva and cornea. Focal ulceration was frequently present at the margin of the eyelids (mucocutaneous transitions), but occasionally also observed at the cornea. Formation of small abscesses occurred within the eyelids of some rats. The palpebral conjunctiva usually showed a diffuse severe goblet cell hyperplasia with formation of pseudoglands, epithelial fO.ldings and abundant production of mucus. HyperplastIc changes of the corneal epithelium were less common. Inflammatory processes were also seen within the extraorbitallacrimal glands and correlated well with the severity of inflammation of the anterior eye portion. The Harderian glands, however, were usually not affected.

body_text.text: Microbiological examination revealed that the rats had no infection with sialodacryoadenitis virus or rat coronavirus. The inflamed tissues, however, were positive for Staphylococcus aureus.
body_text.section: Chronic blepharitis and keratoconjunctivitis in a

body_text.text: Because of the early onset of the eye lesions, they are interpreted to be related to the exposure atmosphere and to stress associated with the wire mesh caging of the rats leading to an impairment of the ocular defense mechanisms and to secondary infection with ubiquitous bacteria.
body_text.section: Chronic blepharitis and keratoconjunctivitis in a

body_text.text: Simian retrovirus-associated fibroendothelial proliferations in the retina of a macaque Simian retroviruses (SRV) are known to induce immunodeficiencies and lymphoproliferative diseases in nonhuman primates. Animals which are fatally infected develop a spectrum of immunologic and hematologic abnormalities which are summarized under the term simian acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (SAIDS). In a protracted course of infection individual macaques develop a persistent lymphadenopathy and splenomegaly which is also reffered to as SAIDS-related complex. This clinical outcome is often accompanied by lymphoproliferative and/or fibroproliferative disorders. Pathognomonic for type D retrovirus infections (SRV -1; SRV -2) commonly connected with SAIDS are a retroperitoneal, mucosal or subcutaneous fibromatosis. Such proliferative lesons can be found localized (nodular/multinodular) or in a progressive form (expansion throughout the abdominal cavities involving adjacent lymph nodes).
body_text.section: Chronic blepharitis and keratoconjunctivitis in a

body_text.text: In the present case a 6 year old female wild-caught Macaca fascicularis showed body weight loss and suffered from blindness for several weeks. The affected animal was serologically SRV negative, but SRV infections were observed in individual animals of the colony. The animal was sacrificed for the clarification of the pathogenesis. No gross findings were noted. Histological examination of both eyes revealed a bilateral focus of proliferating spindle-shaped fibroblasts in the retina in the area of the Discus nervi optici. Peripherally an infiltration of lymphocytic cell was evident and the adjacent retinal cells showed signs of degeneration.
body_text.section: Chronic blepharitis and keratoconjunctivitis in a

body_text.text: Although no other proliferating lesions were observed and in consideration of possible differential diagnoses (hemangiosarcoma, fibrosarcoma, malignant melanoma, retinoblastoma) the present alteration was considered as being a SRV-associated fibromatosis obviously restricted to the retinas of both eyes. A case of a 17.5 year old male cat will be presented with a clinical history of polyuria and polydipsia caused by diabetes mellitus. For the last 2.5 years the cat was treated with subcutaneous insulin injections. Bilateral visual impairment developed and the veterinarian decide to euthanize the animal. Ophthalmologic ally some degeneration was seen in the non tapetal fundus and a mild hyperreflectivity of the feline tapetum was obvious.
body_text.section: Chronic blepharitis and keratoconjunctivitis in a

body_text.text: Retinal lesions in spontaneous, alloxan-induced streptozotocin-induced and other forms of diabetes mellitus are seldom sufficient to cause blindness.
body_text.section: Chronic blepharitis and keratoconjunctivitis in a

body_text.text: In both eyes the neurosensory retina was totally degenerated, atrophic and showed partially a cystoid retinal degeneration. Ultrastructurally the most prominent feature was basement membrane thickening of choroidal and intraretinal vessels, the retinal pigment epithelium and the inner limiting membrane. We also found evidence of degeneration of pericytes and medial smooth muscle cells and few occluded intraretinal capillaries. The neuronal compartment was mostly degenerated; surrounding glial Muller cells and astrocytes were hypertrophic and showed a dramatic increase of cytoplasmic intermediate filaments. The peripheral nerves showed evidence of diabetic autonomic polyneuropathy as described in animals and humans. Retinal vessels of human and animal eyes are characterized by non-fenestrated continuous endothelial cells with tight intercellular junctions, which form the blood-retinal barrier (BRB). Breakdown of the BRB is one of the hallmarks of diabetic retinopathy, and is responsible for macular oedema, the most common cause of visual morbidity in human diabetic patients. This breakdown of the BRB may be also in this case the cause for retinal lesions. After a single high oral dose of a new drug rats died at day 1 until 6. They showed a distended abdomen as a leading symptom. Gross pathology: The jejunum and the ileum were extremely dilated, reddened and filled with a large amount of viscous mucus. The proximal part of the small intestine and the colon appeared normal. The mesenterium was edematous. Histology: The inflammatory reaction (macrophages/granular leukocytes) was mainly observed in the mesenterium and its insertion at the intestine, spreading to the serosa, the muscular layers and the submucosa. The vessels were dilated. The mucosa seemed to be involved secondarily. The villi were shortened and deformed with dilated capillaries and lymphatics. The number of goblet cells were markedly increased, obviously producing masses of mucus. In the forestomach and the glandular stomach some ulcers were found. In the corresponding 4 week toxicity study in general the same changes to a lesser degree were observed. Some animals showed goblet cell hyperplasia, others, lacking the goblet cell hyperplasia, revealed more Paneth cells. Conclusion: In a rat single dose toxicity study and a subacute study, respectively, the distal part of the small intestine was found to be a target organ with peritonitis, congestion, hypersecretion of mucus and decreased tonus of the intestinal wall but continued peristalsis. In a commercial rabbitry with more than 10 000 crossbred (meat hybrid) animals, an increased mortality rate of about 20 % was observed in rabbits short after weaning and moving into the fattening house. Most of the dissected animals had shown a brief period of diarrhea before death, while the remaining died without previous clinical symptoms. Tetracyclin therapy was unsuccessful.
body_text.section: Chronic blepharitis and keratoconjunctivitis in a

body_text.text: Macroscopically, all dissected animals were moderately emaciated. Stomach and small intestine were filled small amounts of greenish-brown liquid ingesta. The cecal content was brownish and foamy.
body_text.section: Chronic blepharitis and keratoconjunctivitis in a

body_text.text: Light microscopically, the complete intestine showed flattening, disorganization, and degeneration of villous epithelia, desquamation and vacuolisation of epithelial cells, as well as focal atrophy and fusion of villi. Numerous round to ovoid bacteria were attached to the luminal brush border. The propria mucosa exhibited slight edema and a varying degree of infiltration by inflammatory cells. The most intense alterations were observed in caudal jejunum, ileum, and cecum. The latter showed the most severe inflammatory processes and occasional crypt dilation due to cellular detritus. In the other parenchymas, specific alterations could not be found.
body_text.section: Chronic blepharitis and keratoconjunctivitis in a

body_text.text: Ultrastructurally, multiple ovoid bacteria of up to 1 x 1,5 11m were found attached perpendicularly or horizontally the luminal surface of cecal villous epithelia. Microvilli were almost totally absent. In some animals, rotavirus or coronavirus particles could additionally be demonstrated in the ingesta by means of negative staining.
body_text.section: Chronic blepharitis and keratoconjunctivitis in a

body_text.text: Microbiologically, Escherichia coli were isolated from the intestine of dissected animals. There were negative for verotoxins VTl and VT2, cytonecrotizing factor, and P-fimbria, but were bearing the eae-gene. Serologically, bacteria were typified as 0103:H2. The aim of this study was to investigate the status of colonization of Helicobacter species (H) in control beagle dogs and dogs treated with an acid inhibitor (AI).
body_text.section: Chronic blepharitis and keratoconjunctivitis in a

body_text.text: Material and methods: The gastric corpus and antrum of dogs used in toxicity studies with AI were examined histologically (control and high doses). 8 samples each were taken by punch (0 1 cm). To identify H in the tissue, slides were stained according to GENTA et al. The number of lymphocytic aggregates (LA) and lymph follicles (LF) were counted. H were evaluated semiquantitatively by a grading score.
body_text.section: Chronic blepharitis and keratoconjunctivitis in a

body_text.text: Results: In controls, diffuse lympho-plasmocytic and focal granular leukocytic infiltrates, as well as LA, LF, microdefects and erosions in the epithelium were observed in the antrum regularly. The antrum was found to be colonized with H in all three mucosal layers (foveolae, neck, crypts). In the corpus there were almost no LA and seldom a superficial inflammatory infiltration. H were found in small numbers in the pits. When dogs were treated with high doses of AI, the amount of H in the antrum decreased. In the corpus, however, H were increased and could be seen more often in the deeper glandular parts and the number of LA/LF increased strikingly.
body_text.section: Chronic blepharitis and keratoconjunctivitis in a

body_text.text: Conclusion: It is assumed that 1) a causative correlation exists between the H infection and the incidence of LAILF in the antrum. 2) under treatment of AI the H colonization "moves" from the antrum to the fundus 3) the "normal" appearance of the canine antrum is the result of a chronic infection with H. The naturally occurring nitrile l-cyano-2-hydroxy-3butene (CHB) represents a breakdown product ofthe glucosinolate progoitrine that is found in many cruciferous plants. As a derivative of hydrocyanic acid CHB is toxic to several animal species. In a risk assessment study about plant nitriles CHB was administered to several inbred and one outbred rat strain in order to evaluate the acute toxicity. Oral doses of 50-100 mg/kg can lead to death cases within 24 hours. Necropsy reveals an acute pancreatitis with colliquative necrosis of the exocrine parenchyma. The necrosis is combined with a significant decrease of the glutathione metabolism of the pancreas. Inbred rat strains like BDElHan, DAlHan or LEWlHan react more sensitive than the outbred Wistar strain.
body_text.section: Chronic blepharitis and keratoconjunctivitis in a

body_text.text: Chronic fibrosing pancreatitis in diabetic rats after long-term exposure to l-cyano-2-hydroxy-3-butene CLAUDIA STARK l and BETTINA KAHRMANN2 lDepartment of Nutritional Toxicology, German Institute of Human Nutrition, Potsdam-Rehbriicke. Current address: c/o Schering AG, Institut fUr Experimentelle Toxikologie, D-13342 Berlin, Germany 2!nstitute of Veterinary Pathology, Freie Universitat, Ber-1m, Germany Key words: Pancreatitis, chronic; l-cyano-2-hydroxy-3butene; Diabetes mellitus l-cyano-2-hydroxy-3-butene, a break down product of the glucosinolate progoitrin, is known to be pancreotoxic in high dosage (over 100 mg/kg bw) leading to an acute necrotizing pancreatitis. The pathogenesis is not exactly known, but there is an acute depletion of glutathione, possibly resulting in the formation of toxic metabolites of l-cyano-2-hydroxy-3-butene. If the dosage is not acutely toxic, the depletion of glutathione is followed by a longterm induction of glutathione synthesis and of glutathione S-transferase in the pancreas, which is postulated to be a chemoprotective effect.
body_text.section: Chronic blepharitis and keratoconjunctivitis in a

body_text.text: We tested the long-term effect of subtoxic dosages of l-cyano-2-hydroxy-3-butene in the spontaneously diabetic BB-rat. This strain develops an autoimmune reaction against the ~-cells in the pancreas, resulting in a type I diabetes. The BB-rats are also known to have a predisposition to mild pancreatitis.
body_text.section: Chronic blepharitis and keratoconjunctivitis in a

body_text.text: Young adult male BBIW orlMol rats were given 10 mg l.-cyano-2-hydroxy-3-butene/kg bw by gavage over a penod of 16 weeks. After 14 to 15 weeks, some of the diabetic rats developed an acute necrotizing pancreatitis leading to sudden death. After 16 weeks, there were also cases of chronic fibrosing pancreatitis with widespread destruction of the exocrine pancreatic cells. However, none of the rats in the control groups and none of the non-diabetic rats exposed to l-cyano-2-hydroxy-3-butene were affected.
body_text.section: Chronic blepharitis and keratoconjunctivitis in a

body_text.text: The pathogenesis of the pancreatitis developed after chronic exposure to acutely sub-toxic dosages of 1cyano-2-hydroxy-3-butene, must be different from that of acute necrosis of the pancreas. The application of 1cyano-2-hydroxy-3-butene possibly forced the formation of autoantibodies against the exocrine pancreas, which is described in diabetic BB-rats, resulting in an autoimmune reaction with destruction of the cells. Using light microscopy, we observed lipomatous lesions in the liver of three out of 4300 CBA/J mice in a transgenerational carcinogenesis study. Only female mice without treatment were affected. The mice were killed at 84/85 or 103 weeks of age in a moribund condition by CO 2 , Macroscopically pale white foci were described in the liver of one animal while in two of the cases a 5 mm pale white nodule was seen. These two nodules showed a distinct compression of the normal liver tissue microscopically. The proliferated cells were smaller than hepatocytes with dark oval nuclei. Some of these cells were spindle-shaped and had pale eosinophilic cytoplasm. The majority of the tumour cells contained vacuoles of different size. Signs of malignancy could not be observed. DIXON et al. (1994) have published similar findings in the liver of B6C3Fl mice. They discovered this lipomatous lesion in thirteen out of 90.000 mice re-evaluated from the database and although the authors could not determine its exact cellular origin, an "Ito cell proliferation" was discussed. The animal investigated was a 6-months-old female guinea pig which had died without clinical symptoms.
body_text.section: Chronic blepharitis and keratoconjunctivitis in a

body_text.text: Post-mortem examination disclosed focal alopezia, hyperkeratosis, and panniculitis of the skin, and acute congestion of lung, liver, and spleen.
body_text.section: Chronic blepharitis and keratoconjunctivitis in a

body_text.text: Light microscopically, the animal showed a severe focal mononuclear interstitial nephritis, accompanied by lymphohistiocytic perivascular infiltrations and a focal increase of interstitial fibroblasts. Besides, focal tubular degeneration and intratubular spherical bodies of varying size were observed. According to their morphology, the latter were identified as Klossiella cobayae development stages. Additionally, focal interstitial pneumonia was diagnosed.
body_text.section: Chronic blepharitis and keratoconjunctivitis in a

body_text.text: In general, Klossiella infection which has up to now been demonstrated in equids, mice, bats, opossums, various rodents, boa constrictor, and guinea pigs, remains asymptomatic. Clinical and macroscopic alterations, represented by minute gray spots in the renal cortex, are only observed in animals exposed to massive stress (e.g. emaciation, transport, primary infections). Klossiella are protozoan parasites belonging to the subclass coccidia. Key words: Arteritis, immune mediated; Immune mediated arteritis; Kidney, arteritis; Pancreas, arteritis; Serum sickness Cynomolgus monkeys received a human cytokine produced using biotechnological methods as the active ingredient of the test compound together with human serum albumin (HSA) as carrier protein by subcutaneous injections for 4 weeks (every 2nd day). Besides routine histological examination, immunotoxicity analyses such as determination of specific anti-cytokine, anti-HSA antibody (AB) formation and total complement hemolytic activity (CH50) in serum were carried out.
body_text.section: Chronic blepharitis and keratoconjunctivitis in a

body_text.text: Histopathology revealed marked alterations in the kidneys and pancreas of the high dose treated group. In the kidneys middle sized and large arteries were infiltrated with eosinophilic granulocytes and a mixture of lymphocytes and plasma cells. The extended edematous adventitia showed signs of fibroangioblastic proliferation which indicate chronicity of the lesion. Focal fibrinoid degeneration of the media and intema with subsequent proliferation of intimal endothelial cells was observed. Neither small arteries nor renal glomeruli were affected. In the pancreas large and small vessels in the interlobular connective tissue were infiltrated with the similar profile of inflammatory cells, while the exocrine as well as endocrine parenchyma were only sparsely altered. Further findings included the hyperplasia of various lymph nodes.
body_text.section: Chronic blepharitis and keratoconjunctivitis in a

body_text.text: The histopathological appearence suggested an immune complex mediated damage in the affected tissues which was confirmed by the obtained immunotoxicity data. A moderate rise of anti-cytokine AB as well as pronounced anti-HSA AB-titers associated with decreased CH50-activity were detected from week 2 onwards. CH50 decrease indicates a continuous complement activation due to permanent antigen-antibody interaction leading to formation of immune complexes.
body_text.section: Chronic blepharitis and keratoconjunctivitis in a

body_text.text: Observed results revealed a strong correlation between anti-HSA AB titer level and expression of vascular lesions but no correlation to anti-cytokine titer indicating that HSA is the causative agent for the immune complex mediated vasculitis. An explanation for the exclusion of normally affected glomeruli in the kidney is not available. Liposarcomas are uncommon spontaneous findings in domestic animals and other species. Based on a review of data the frequency of this tumour type in the laboratory rat is generally less than 0.1 % (1).
body_text.section: Chronic blepharitis and keratoconjunctivitis in a

body_text.text: The tumour was first detected in a lO-week old male control rat (Fisher 344, CD-derived, Charles River, USA) used in a chronic toxicity study and grew continuously until week 42 of life when the animal was sacrificed. At necropsy (animal weight: 532 g) a soft mass with a size of 14 x 7 x 5 cm (tumour weight: 232 g) was found, mainly coloured yellow-white with orange-reddish foci. A slight tendence of infiltration into the surrounding tissue was observed but no distant metastases recorded. Myxoid, mucous (producing tumour areas (Alcian-Blue-Stain, pH 2.5) and PAS-reaction positive) were mixed with marked stromal tissue components (positive in reticulin and collagen staining, Gomori and Masson's trichome). All tumour cells stained positively for neutral fat (Sudan VIIb) on frozen section. Fat vacuoles were confirmed by electron microscopy evaluation. Immunohistochemically, the majority of the tumor cells were positively stained for S 100 and a minority showed also a positive reaction against desmin. Other immunohisto-chemical stainings (cytokeratin, factor VIII, actin myoglobin) were negative. Wistar rats received a lipophilic fluid test substance by intravenous injection for up to four weeks. Among several other organs the spleen showed changes which were qualitatively and quantitatively dose dependent. The high dose caused a severe vacuolation and hyperplasia of the red pulp, a slight vacuolation of the white pulp, and a moderate hyperplastic reaction of the peri arteriolar lymphoid sheets. At lower doses only a minimal vacuolation and moderate hyperplasia of the red pulp occurred, but also a pronounced lymphoid reaction as evidenced by follicular hyperplasia and hyperplasia of the periarteriolar lymphoid sheets.
body_text.section: Chronic blepharitis and keratoconjunctivitis in a

body_text.text: In various other organs the test substance induced accumulations of macrophages in veins and venules. Most capillaries of the lung and renal glomeruli were dilated. The hepatic Kupffer cells were vacuolized and activated.
body_text.section: Chronic blepharitis and keratoconjunctivitis in a

body_text.text: The spleen of a rabbit, which received a single high dose of the test substance intravenously, showed multiple infarcts in the marginal zone of the spleen.
body_text.section: Chronic blepharitis and keratoconjunctivitis in a

body_text.text: The observed test substance induced effects are directly or indirectly caused by its lipophilic properties. The test substance was cleared from the blood stream predominantly by the macrophages of the red pulp. Its accumulation in phagocytosing cells caused the vacuolation of the red pulp, an effect which is also described after administration of liposomes. Presumably an adjuvance-like effect has led to the hyperplastic reaction of the white pulp. Due to an extreme overloading of reticulohistiocytic cells this effect was less pronounced in the high dose. Significant amounts of the test substance were phagozytosed by intravascular macrophages. Accumulations of macrophages or test substance occluded the peniciliary arteries and caused therefore multiple infarcts in the marginal zone of a single rabbit. All induced changes observed in rats were reversible or showed at least a tendency towards reversibility after a 6 weeks recovery period.
body_text.section: Chronic blepharitis and keratoconjunctivitis in a

FIGREF7.text: They show a direct life cycle. Ingestion of sporocysts leads to the release of sporozoites which circulate and parasitize the endothelial cells of small vessels in kidney, lung, spleen, and other organs. Primary schizonts develop predominantly in glomerular endothelial cells. Built merozoites invade epithelial cells of the proximal convoluted tubules where the secondary schizogony takes place. Released merozoites undergo sexual stages in the loops of Henle. Fertilized gametes develop into sporonts which bud to form sporoblasts. Each sporoblast undergoes successive divisions to form sporocysts containing sporozoites which are shed with the urine. back_matter.text: The microsomal enzyme aromatase is localized in the follicular granulosa cells and catalyzes the conversion of androstenedione (4-androstene-3, 17 -dione) into estrone. In the present study an inhibitor of this enzyme was administered to female mature NMRI mice for 13 weeks by gavage.At necropsy no compound-related macroscopic findings or changes in the weights of ovaries and uterus were noted. However, histological examinations of ovaries revealed a marked loss of corpora lutea and a reduction in the number of follicles. Some remaining follicles showed cyst formation of their cavum. Furthermore, a pronounced atrophy combined with a marked cytoplasmic foamy vacuolation ("luteinization") of the ovarian interstitial glands was observed. Atrophy of the ovaries was in contrast to findings in uterus, cervix and vagina. In the uterus the luminal and glandular epithelium showed hypertrophy and hyperplasia, partially with cystic dilatation of glands. Endometrial stroma had predominantly spindle-shaped cells with focal areas of fibrosis. The cervix and vagina had hyperplastic squamous epithelium with inclusions of cornified epithelial cells. In some areas an incomplete cornification of the superficial layers was detected. Focal infiltration of neutrophils was chiefly located in the superficial epithelial layers.The morphological changes in the uterus, cervix and vagina indicated an estrogenic effect on these organs. The pathogenesis of the compound-induced changes is not completely elucidated. The aromatase inhibitor led to a decreased synthesis of endogenous oestrogens leading to a lowered hormone level and inducing the bilateral ovarian atrophy. The pronounced vacuolation of inter-stitial ovarian cells may be ascribed to the accumulation of oestrogen precursor steroids. However, marked estrogenic effects were observed in the remaining female genital tract. Since the aromatase inhibitor has no estrogenic activity it could not contribute to this effect. Presumably the observed cystic follicles in the ovary were secreting low amounts of estrogens continuously which, in conjunction with the lack of progesterone (no corpora lutea), resulted in an estrenism-like condition. The slide came from an individual animal which died in week 89 in a carcinogenicity study. This animal had a large red brown nodule in one liver lobe. The abdominal cavity of this animal contained fresh blood. Microscopic examination revealed that this nodule was compatible to a lesion previously described as Kupffer cell sarcoma.The tumor consisted of large pleomorphic cells with abundant cytoplasm growing along the liver plates and forming cystic blood filled spaces. Multinucleated cells, pleomorphic nuclei, and occasional erythrophagocytosis was noted. In some classifications this tumor is considered to be a SUbtype of hemangiosarcoma. The ultrastructure and immunocytochemistry of these cells will be presented.
